content.content: The House Tomato is a curious variety of the tomato plant,

, a perennial originally from South America. This variety is especially small. Its leaves are fleshy like a succulent. Allegedly, it can be cut back at the end of summer and brought indoors until it can be left outside again in springtime. There are reports of these plants lasting for years. Who has ever heard of such a thing?
Here's what one of my house tomato plants looks like after starting indoors and being left outside for about a month. Image taken April 18, 2025

Here is another house tomato plant with immature fruits, three months later on July 10, 2025. In retrospect, I think I should've used gallon pots rather than these smaller ceramic pots. After harvest and some time before spring I'll up pot them.
